metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4491 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The d_print_comp function in cp-demangle.c in libiberty allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via acrafted binary, which triggers infinite recursion and a buffer overflow,related to a node having "itself as ancestor more than once."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

valgrind - 1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu2
valgrind-mpi - 1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

ht - 2.1.0+repack1-1
No subscription required

gdb - 8.0-0ubuntu3
gdb-multiarch - 8.0-0ubuntu3
gdb-source - 8.0-0ubuntu3
gdb64 - 8.0-0ubuntu3
gdbserver - 8.0-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

binutils - 2.29-1ubuntu1

criterions.comment: valgrind package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu2').
ht package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0+repack1-1').
gcc-h8300-hms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
gdb package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0-0ubuntu3').

binutils package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.29-1ubuntu1').
